description: Borrowed from Hindi पीपल / Urdu پیپل‎ (pīpal), from Sanskrit पिप्पल (pippala).  Doublet of falafel and pepper.

examples: This was about the time she caught me in the branches of the peepul tree a good mile and a quarter up river on the banks of the Gambhiree, spying on the women who went there to wash their clothes and themselves.
